001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.Array;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
006
007/**
008 * A specialization of {@link EstimationFunction} for functions that produce
009 * a single scalar output.
010 * <p>
011 * Provides a scalar-valued estimation method, while also offering a default
012 * vector-based interface compatible with {@link EstimationFunction}.
013 */
014@Strategy(Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
015public interface ScalarEstimationFunction<N extends Number> extends EstimationFunction<N> {
016
017    /**
018     * Estimates the output of this function for the given input vector,
019     * returning the result as a single-element array.
020     *
021     * @param inputs the input feature vector
022     * @return a single-element array containing {@link #estimateScalar(Array)}
023     */
024    default Array<N> estimate(Array<N> inputs) {
025        Array<N> array = getNumberTypeSupport().createArray(1);
026        array.set(0, estimateScalar(inputs));
027        return array;
028    }
029
030    /**
031     * Estimates the scalar output of this function for the given input vector.
032     *
033     * @param inputs the input feature vector
034     * @return the scalar output value
035     */
036    N estimateScalar(Array<N> inputs);
037
038    /**
039     * Returns the number of output values (co-arity) of this function.
040     * For a scalar estimation function, this is always {@code 1}.
041     *
042     * @return the co-arity, always {@code 1}
043     */
044    default int coArity() {
045        return 1;
046    }
047}
